args: Phew. That's another long shift in the bag.\nHelping out at the Kitty Cafe is tough work.
And I'm exhausted after a full day of\nexercise. When's dinner?
Hey, you two. Heading back now?
Hello, Mitsuhide. It's rare to see you\ngracing the beach with your presence.
Heh heh heh. My sworn enemy, the sun,\nhas retreated beyond the horizon line.
I'm just enjoying a little victory lap.\nFrom now till dawn is MY time.
It's only under veil of night when the REAL\nfun begins. Either of you care to partake?
Your confusion belies your curiosity!\nJust follow me, ladies. Heh heh heh...
It was then the ghost at the front door\nwhispered...
＂The ones who died...were all of you\ninside the room!＂
Holy smokes... That one hit different, huh,\nLuca? I got chills all up 'n down my body!
Yeah... Me too. You'd think it was the\ndead of winter with the way my teeth're\nchattering!
Erm... Mitsuhide? What are we...\nWhat is this?
The Great Summer Cool-Off Ghoul-Off. It's\ncustom in Hinomoto to beat the heat on\nsummer nights by telling spooky stories.
Whatcha think? Hard to feel hot when cold\nsweat is dripping down your back, right?
It's...not really doing much for me. I'm a\nlittle old to still believe in these sorts of\nthings. Right, Amane?
BWAH! N-n-n-no! I'm a grown lady. Such\nsilly tales are for children; I would never—
Aha ha ha! You're terrified!\nOh, that's adorable.
MITSUHIDE! I shall thank you not to tease\nme! Children should show their elders\nrespect.
What?! I'm no child! If anyone here's still\na kid, it's YOU, Amane.
In what POSSIBLE way am I a child?!\nI've been a fully grown adult for ages!
Now, now. You little gals should be\nsticking together, not—
Pfft... Aha ha ha ha ha! Ohhh, this is\ntoo fun. This ＂veil of night＂ stuff rules.

Glad I could help you see the light. Er,
the lack thereof? Anyway, a very wise,
very important Hinomotoan once said
that summer is all about the nights!
It's cooler and more comfortable than the\ndaytime, and there's no end to the fun\nstuff you can do.
Huh... Now that you mention it, it IS quite\ncomfortable, compared to this afternoon.
Perhaps I should get my jog in before\nthe sun rises. I could probably cover\nconsiderably more distance.
Sounds a lot more efficient than doing it\nin the sweltering heat and needing to\ncatch your breath every five minutes.
When the hateful sun vacates the sky,\nthat's our time to do whatever we please.
All just another front in our\nrebellion against summer.
Ah, I get it! So living it up at night was\nall part of your master plan.
Havin' fun AND dodgin' the heat... Maybe\nthis rebellion thing ain't crazy after all.
Finally catching on, are we? Now, what\ndo you say we head down to the shore\nwith these?
Ooh, aren't those the handheld\npyroblossoms Su Fang was working on?
Nice! I bet pyroblossoms are even\nprettier at night!
Then it's decided. All units, forward march!\nWhat's our rallying cry?!
SUN'S OUT, FUN'S OUT!\nNIGHT TIME, RIGHT TIME!
I-is everything all right, Cleo?\nYou sound rather upset.
Good morning, {player_name}.\nI'm glad to see you're awake.\n...That makes two of us.
Mitsuhide has been spreading her anti-\ndaytime gospel, and now everyone's gone\ncompletely nocturnal.
I will admit that sleeping by day and\nwaking at night lets you avoid the sun,\nbut...
Buuut now everyone's taken to\nsnoozing till the day's half-gone.
*sigh* They're all free to wage their little\nrevolution, and sleeping in while on\nvacation isn't a crime...
But I do wish they'd consider the person in\ncharge of making breakfast.
Starting tomorrow, anyone out of bed after\nmid-morning can just wait until lunch!
